Package hw4

Class FollowerElement

java.lang.Object
api.AbstractElement
hw4.SimpleElement
hw4.MovingElement
hw4.AssociatedElement
hw4.FollowerElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable
public class FollowerElement extends AssociatedElement
A follower element is one that is associated with another "base" element such as a PlatformElement or LiftElement. Specifically, the follower element's movement is determined by the movement of the base element, when the base moves up 10 pixels, the follower moves up 10 pixels. However, the follower may not always be at a fixed location relative to the base. When the horizontal velocity of the follower is set to a non-zero value, the follower will oscillate between the left and right edges of the PlatformElement or LiftElement it is associated with. This class extends the abstract class AssociatedElement.
Author:
Nicholas Jacobs

  • Constructor Details

    • FollowerElement

      public FollowerElement(int width, int height, int initialOffset)
      Constructs a new FollowerElement. Before being added to a "base" element such as a PlatformElement or LiftElement, the x and y coordinates are zero. When a base element is set, the initial x-coordinate becomes the base's x-coordinate, plus the given offset, and the y-coordinate becomes the base's y-coordinate, minus this element's height.
      Parameters:
      width - element's width
      height - element's height
      initialOffset - when added to a base, this amount will be added to the bases's x-coordinate to calculate this element's initial x-coordinate

  • Method Details

    • move

      protected void move()
      Overrides MovingElement's move() to be called in update(). Checks whether the bounds are correct and updates this element's position accordingly to the direction that it is moving. Movement is determined by the movement of the base element, when the base move up 10 pixels, the follower moves up 10 pixels. However, the follower may not always be at a fixed location relative to the base. When the horizontal velocity of the follower is set to a non-zero value, the follower will oscillate between the left and right edges of the PlatformElement or LiftElement it is associated with.
      Overrides:
      move in class MovingElement
      See Also:
      • checkBounds()
      • SimpleElement.setPosition(double, double)
      • switchVelocity(double, double)
      • distanceTillBound()
      • MovingElement.move()
